intro: Cansjera madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
